channel.title: Grand Exchange update detection bot

item.title: Grand Exchange update detection bot
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

Davidi2:

I have ~13m cash to spend, instead of pulling a casey and buying a few hundred mil from usFine, what’s a good item to flip?

Look through the GE graphs of rune and dragon equipment on the site. I always find something that’ s going up in price from that category, and they usually sell by the next morning. Remember when your choosing an item, try to think about whether it is in high demand by pkers, skillers, or other large categories of players.

OT: You should add a sniping feature.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Exchange update detection bot
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

When you don’t have much money, items below 1k in value are best. Runes, popular raw food, coal, etc.
For f2p you can do things like natures, deaths, coal, mithril ore, raw lobsters, raw swordfish.

The limit on runes is 25k every 4 hours. For raw food it’s 20k every 4 hours, and ores are 25k every 4 hours.
Once you buy an item, you have to wait 4 hours before it will be allowed to sell. Don’t shit bricks and think that you’re going to take a huge loss – it’s a protection mechanism.
Just be patient.

[quote=“sppt, post:8, topic:378971”]So, I started to notice that a certain pattern was evolving, regarding the updates.
During the day, the bot has shouted “GE UPDATED!!1! LOL” every 2 hours.[/quote]
I know. I’ll have to look into it again later.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Exchange update detection bot
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

cooper:

Yeah, I figured it would have to be bulk, but I was more concerned about a max for that period of time.

careful with what you buy if you only have a little money I started off with around 1m and worked my way up to 2m and some black trim (g) but i’m also sitting on many items that I can’t sell due to loss of profit so take a look at the ge and find stable items (items that only fluctuate gradually) to start. Then you can start pushing risky items. Another thing I like to do is flop around different “merchanting guilds” as I always sell what they are trying to buy in bulk at max price.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Exchange update detection bot
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:10, topic:378971”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=474827.msg3473110#msg3473110 date=1295457934]
Can someone give me some pointers on how to make money from the GE? What’s this flipping system.
[/quote]

ok ill give you a shit example, buy rune scims at around 3AM eastern standard time for a lower price, sell them at about 3pm eastern standard price for a higher price. You will be able to do this as many U.S. school children come home from school between 3 - 6 eastern standard time (as the west coast is behind a few hours) and start pking. during 3 am however most children are sleeping so the stock of rune scims bulks up. This method does not work so much on weekends[/quote]
Yes, basically, you act based on the fact that a lot of people don’t have time to wait for an item to buy, so they buy at max.
However, there’s always items being dumped at min, and here’s where you come in: You buy in low, and sell high.

Obviously it works best with high demand items, but that’s the essence of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Exchange update detection bot
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Could have implemented something like that but decided it wasn’t worth the work.

Reality is that this is mostly so people who flip items in-game (sppt, TehSpede, myself, and anyone else) can check when the last update occurred and view the change in price for the items they want to flip.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Exchange update detection bot
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

This bot just idles in IRC and tells the channel when a grand exchange update has occurred.
There are a handful of commands that allow users to do things such as view the time since the GE was last updated, view the stats of a username, view the price information of an item, etc.

Do whatever you want with it.

@Mopar, I’ve sent you a copy to host if you’re still interested.

Read full topic
